known_issues.title: Electron Filesystem Adapter Dynamic Import Failure
known_issues.description: The Electron filesystem adapter fails to load due to dynamic import bundling issues. When running in Electron, the dynamic import('./electron') statement is processed by Next.js/Turbopack bundler, which tries to serve it as an HTTP chunk from localhost:3004/_next/static/chunks/electron, resulting in a 404 error.
known_issues.error_message: Failed to fetch dynamically imported module: http://localhost:3004/_next/static/chunks/electron
known_issues.root_cause: Dynamic imports in Electron renderer process are still analyzed by the bundler even when using new Function() to hide the import path. The bundler converts the relative import to a URL-based chunk, which cannot be loaded in the Electron context.

workaround.description: Added try-catch fallback in platform.ts to gracefully fall back to Web adapter (File System Access API) when Electron adapter fails to load. App remains functional using browser-style file pickers.
commits: 1091437 - fix(electron): Fix Electron filesystem adapter import path
99f8439 - fix(electron): Add graceful fallback when Electron adapter fails to load

permanent_solution.approach: Implement proper IPC-based filesystem operations through Electron preload script and main process. Expose filesystem methods via contextBridge instead of trying to load Node.js modules in renderer.
steps: Add IPC handlers in main.ts for filesystem operations (selectDirectory, readTree, readFile, etc.)
Expose filesystem API via preload.ts using contextBridge
Create Electron filesystem adapter that uses window.electronAPI instead of Node.js fs module

known_issues.impact: Medium - Users can still use the app with File System Access API, but lose native filesystem benefits like absolute paths and persistent access without permissions.

known_issues.title: File System Access API Handle Verification Failures in Electron
known_issues.description: When using File System Access API fallback in Electron, handle verification fails with 'The request is not allowed by the user agent or the platform in the current context' error.
known_issues.error_message: Handle verification failed: DOMException: The request is not allowed by the user agent or the platform in the current context.
known_issues.root_cause: Electron's implementation of File System Access API may have restrictions or incompatibilities with persistent handle verification. This is expected when using browser APIs in Electron context.
affected_components: File System Access API in Electron renderer

workaround.description: Error is logged but doesn't crash the app. Users may need to re-select directories more frequently than in browser.

permanent_solution.approach: Will be resolved by implementing native IPC-based filesystem (same solution as ELECTRON-ADAPTER-001)

known_issues.impact: Low - Cosmetic error in console, may require occasional re-authorization of directory access.
